greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of elements in the continued fraction for Sum_{d|n} 1/d.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: It seems that Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ C*n*log(n) with C = 0.6....
example: Sum_{d|48} 1/d = 31/12, whose continued fraction is [2, 1, 1, 2, 2] with 5 elements, hence a(48)=5.
mathematica: a[n_] := Length@ContinuedFraction[DivisorSigma[1, n]/n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 30 2019 *)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 09 2002
